intervention_catalogue.name: Developing Assertiveness for Women in Relationships (DAWN)
intervention_catalogue.short_description: The aim of this intervention is to give women the skills and tools to manage their unhealthy behaviour in partner relationships.
intervention_catalogue.long_description: The aim of this intervention is to give women the skills and tools to manage their unhealthy behaviour in partner relationships.
intervention_catalogue.session_detail: 1 x one-to-one session and 6 x group sessions

enabling_intervention_detail: If the person meets the criteria for an Accredited Programme, or another Structured Intervention, they can participate in Developing Assertiveness for Women in Relationships (DAWN) alongside it.
possible_outcomes: The aim of this intervention is to enable women to start managing challenges, such as:
* social skills and emotional mismanagement or self-regulation
This will be done by increasing awareness of needs and wants, and how to communicate these appropriately without violence or aggression.

risk_consideration.cn_score_guide:
Intimate partner violence related offence. This can be index (indicated by OASys 2.3d) or historical (indicated by OASys 6.7). This includes:
* relationship problems
* social skills deficits
* attitudes that support relationship violence
* aggression and anger
* emotional mismanagement or self-regulation
risk_consideration.ogrs_score_guide: If OVP not available, then OGRS3: score 25+

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: The person you are referring must be able to read and understand simple sentences.

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: If there are less than 9 months remaining on the licence or community order, you should check with the Treatment Manager.
exclusion.alcohol_drug_problem_guide: Any alcohol or drug-related problems must be stable before attending the programme
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: People with mental health problems should only be excluded from the programme if the issues are acute and damage their ability to relate to others or concentrate.
exclusion.not_allowed_if_eligible_for_another_inte: The person you are referring must not be suitable for, or be unable to access an Accredited Programme.
exclusion.literacy_level: The person you are referring must be able to read and understand simple sentences.
